verses.roman:
prabhu kahena,--kaha, teṅho paḍe kṛṣṇa-līlā
premāveśe prabhura deha-mana āyuyāilā

synonyms: prabhu kahena—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu said; kaha—please go on speaking; teṅho—he; paḍe—recites; kṛṣṇa-līlā—the pastimes of Lord Kṛṣṇa; prema-āveśe—in great ecstasy of love; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; deha-mana—body and mind; āyuyāilā—became slackened.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu requested Raghupati Upādhyāya to continue speaking about the pastimes of Śrī Kṛṣṇa. Thus the Lord was absorbed in ecstatic love, and His mind and body slackened.

purport.content: Our minds and bodies are always engaged in material activities. When they are activated on the spiritual platform, they slacken on the material platform.
